column4: Never go for this - Review after 8 months of use
column5:
Eureka Forbes Vacuum cleaner is being used at my home for last 30 years. I had bought this one to use it upstairs. It can be described as just a Chinese one branded in their name. Such a flimsy structure. The motor of supposed 1200w delivers a quarter of its power only. This one is just 8 months old and is DEAD now. I have booked a service and as usual there is no response from anyone.

You can know the company's attitude from certain things.
‚óè They don't disclose their service center's location or phone. The only access is their customer-care which is a premium charged number. Whenever you call the customer-care, you get the so-called parroting message. They don't want anyone to contact them. Any other company, you can take the product to their service centre at your convenient time and pick it up back the same. Here, you have to wait for the technician any time any day for 1 or 2 months.
‚óè There are three stages of escalation. Believe me, the third stage is a "Eureka Forbes Ombudsman". But none of the web forms work. In this new age, they require the customers to download, print and fill-up the form and send it by ordinary post. See the attitude.
‚óè They always confuse you using the words direct channel, indirect, franchisee, agent, sub-agent, etc. One guy would come and sell you some product or AMC with proper invoice and another guy would tell you that it is not the correct route and would deny service.
‚óè They deleted my comment on their facebook page detailing my complaint. Just read the comments on their Facebook and Twitter pages, and you'll know.

Eureka Forbes had a point years back when it was a monopoly in the market. I know, in my childhood, the executive would give a demo as if it had rocket science inside. The picture is changed. There are quality products with much advanced features at quite low prices. Never go for any Eureka Forbes product. Never expect any service from them.

column4: DISAPPOINTED- Feel I am cheated by a renowned company
column5:

The light weight vacuum cleaner with a range of accessories and features is truly a value for money.

I tried for a replacement to buy a better one but they said if the product is not damaged they won't take the return. It is disappointing. I wouldn't want refund , I only would have opted for a better machine. But seems I am stuck with this one. Have to buy a sturdy and heavy duty machine later but am not going to buy something anytime soon. So LOOK before you LEAP. I repeat do not get swayed by the reviews here or in YouTube. No to paid reviews or else you will end up wasting money on such fancy- looking-good - for- nothing's.\n

column4: Cheap shoddy sub-standard construction and terrible customer service..
column5:
I purchased this item approximately 6 months ago..works well..does the job..
But then the handle broke.. I just picked it up and it just split apart..
I made a complaint to Amazon and they arranged a visit from Eureka Forbes..
the service person arranged a call back from one of their regional managers.. his explanation and offer was astounding.

He said that all the Indian made eureka Forbes products are weak in construction..
His solution was to take it back and provide me with 1000 rupees off on a vaccuum cleaner which was manufactured abroad and costs approx 15000. ( Euroclean WD X2)
1. There is only one way to hold this vacuum cleaner and that part just split apart like some weak toy..
2. The company is aware that the product is weak and substandard but yet they continue to sell it... duping customers who have faith in Eureka Forbes.

Please do reconsider all future purchases from this brand as they clearly have very interest in selling quality products..

Product is Good and Powerful, Can be used for daily use, do not expect that monthly, cleaning will be satisfactory with it.

My main purpose was sofa cleaning, and deep corners cleaning, that is done in a very Good Way.

The cord length is also enough, if you want then you can carry the cleaner in one hand and the other can be used to handle the suction also.

Very useful. And very well designed.
Good suction power, more than sufficient chord length and easy to empty-and- easy to clean dust jar.
We live in a rural setting., in a dry and windy region. Hence unlimited dust, and severe cobweb menace.
We ran this machine today for two and a half hours, with smal breaks every ten or so minutes to move furniture here and there. Machine would still have gone on.
The dust collection jar was one fourth full as you can see in the picture (can you see a live spider in there? :)), Still we wanted to empty it, so simply dug a hole in the garden, and covering our noses with masks, emptied the jar's contents into the hole and put the soil back in!
The machine has good, big, comfortable wheels., so maneuverability was not an issue. Its attachments were long enough to reach our roof. We have used the crevice tool extensively throghout- once we are done with cobbwebs we will start using the machine for floors.

column4: Superb product. Best in the league!
column5:
Delivery: Great. Got it in less than 14 hours after ordering (in Mumbai). In perfect condition.

The product is amazing. It has one extendable rod, one bendable pipe and two extra extensions. They are limited but very multipurpose and useful in all situations. No need for more namesake attachables.

The suction power is the best.
I have used 800W & 1600W models of other brands in the past but wasn‚Äôt happy.
If deep vacuum cleaning is what you want, don‚Äôt fall for the handy-cordless 800W ones. They do nothing. This 1900W is a beast and you can literally see the color of the surface changing after the cleaning.
The toughest areas are window sliders & pigeon feathers on artificial grass in lawn or balcony. It worked great!!

It has three modes-
One for sofa & curtains
One for carpets & artificial grass
One for hard floor.
The system is very simple and sturdy.
The quality of the extensions & cables is premium.

Cleaning is simple too.
Don‚Äôt burn your money on Dyson or fall for the Chinese items. Better than Eureka & Kent.
This is best for it price!
5 Stars.

Writing after using for a few months. This is an excellent compact vacuum cleaner for home use. Cutting one star only for noise generated.

Pros:
- Easy to move around on the wheels
- Good suction power
- Cord length is long enough to access two rooms without having to unplug
- Since it is bagless, there are no disposable dustbags.
- The dust collection chamber is designed really well. The chamber, filter and the cover can be dismantled and washed with water. So it's very easy to clean.

Cons:

- No fittings to reach higher locations

column4: Bit disappointed with the Cleaning considering the huge sucking power.
column5:
Pros:
 1. High Suction Power (1900W)
 2. Metal Rod.
 3. High quality Plastic.
 4. Compact design

Cons:
 1. Noisy above 1 ( that restricts the usage to certain hours of the day only to avoid disturbance to the neighbors in an Apartment )
 2. Does not suck hair or minute dust that effectively. After vacuum, I could sense the dust while I walk, it wasn't the case with my previous vacuum cleaner. This is kind of disappointing as the power it has. I think, it is because of actual surface area of the vacuum roller base. We think that entire area where the roller travels will suck it, but only near the center portion of the roller base sucks the dust. Hence you need to move it multiple times in a particular area.
3. Not very effective in cleaning spider webs. Have to be bit careful otherwise it black web sticks to the wall itself.

Still managing with this as my return period is over. Now a days, Not very enthusiastic in vacuuming my house due to these limitations.

column4: Good product but misleading listing - No True Hepa filter but only Hepa 10
column5:
The vaccum cleaner itself is very good. The suction power is very powerful (you have to be careful where you point it), the cord and pipe length is sufficient and quality is sturdy. What I didn't like was-

1. Delivery- Outer box was in very bad shape, broken at many places. It just takes away the happiness out of the whole experience initially.

2. The misleading product description - It has Hepa 10 filter and not Hepa 13 as mentioned here on its page. Hepa 13 is the best filter and they have mentioned that this vaccum cleaner has it, but what is clearly mentioned on the box and on the vaccum cleaner is the fact that it is only Hepa 10, not true hepa.

3. Lack of attachments - The attachments provided are few and you most probably will have to buy some extras like I am planning to do. They have focussed on turbo brush which is second one for carpets, but in Indian settings one attachment for carpets is sufficient and some other useful ones like brushes for attaching to the extension pipe are required.

column4: Returned. Was defective. But sturdy and good design with 1800 watts power.

The power plug was getting heated. It seems it had a defective motor. So i returned. Also the package seemed a once opened abd tested piece.\n

column4: Very Good Product can definitely go ahead
column5:
(1) Delivered one day in advance than the schedule delivery date.
(2)Safely packed. All contents were received without any scratch mark.
(3) Installation is easy however, for easy of doing referred to a utube vdo. There r too many.
(4)Used for a shorter duration and found it to be very effective. Used only 2 accessories /4
(5)Suction power is very strong. Blower option is not there.
(6) Easy to clean the dust bin as well.
(7)Based on my 1st day's experience, shall definitely recommend to go ahead with this vacuum cleaner.

1) Suction Power: I would say it has best suction power in its range. It cleaned sofa dirt so deeply and easily that now I sees real color of my sofas. It suction power is really powerful. I have seen other vaccume cleaners also then I am saying. It is also good in car cleaning.
2) Cord Length: It has almost 6 mtr cord which is really enough large to take it every corner of home. It has cord winder which wind the cord within vaccume cleaner body at bottom. So you no need to worry about cord management.
3) Dirt Filter: It has dirt filter section where it collects dirt. It does not contain paper dirt bag which makes it most convenient dirt filter. Which can be cleaned and wash very easily.
4) Design: I would love to give it 5 star for its design.
5) Large Wheels: It has very large wheels. Which are very pretty in design and makes it convenient for movement.
6) Accessories:Box contains 5 accessories.
1- Extension Pipe: It has approx 4 feet long Extension pipe which can be attached to another 5 feet long rigid plastic pipe to make it lengths upto 9 feet. Enough Large.
2- Plastic Hose: It has 5 feet long rigid plastic pipe which is very flexible and has brush attached to it which helps to clean the windows etc.
3- Two suction paddle: It has two suction paddle to clean mattress, floor etc.
4- 1 suction small pipe nose to deep clean sofa corners.

This is a blessing, I scrolled through various options before finalising this one. My selection criteria's were
1. Retractable cord
2. Bagless
3. Suction power
4. All in one stand / storage
5. Decent sound
6. Heavy duty parts

To begin with, As the product came I tested my hands on my fabric sofa which I last got cleaned in Jun 19. Trust me you will not regret buying this. Yes it‚Äôs on a higher side pricing but totally worth it.
Those tiny spaces behind bed are sparklingly clean.
Window cleaning is so easy, my maid is surely regretting because I am not paying her addon amount for dusting üòÄ

\n I bought this product after doing my fair bit of research. Although i had some inhibitions regarding the value for money it would provide, but after using it I can assure you that every penny spent on this product is worth. Good suction power, excellent cleaning and very easy maneuverability. The bagless design makes it easy clean and user friendly. A great product from Philips. Must buy!!\n

Recommended

We went for purchase to reliance digital and other shops but they seem to be biased towards our previous brand. So we took a chance here with Philips and we're more than satisfied.

So folks, if you're into deep cleaning, don't like to dust the dirt bags after every use, looking for good suction - Philips won't disappoint you

Like any other buyers, after alot of comparisons here and there, finally settled on this device. The product is of Good quality as you can see. It is priced reasonably. If you buy cheaper ones, you might have to compromise on quality and efficiency.

column4: A real competition to Google Home mini
column5:
At first i was confused which one to buy - Google home mini or Echo dot. After considering few factors I decided to buy this echo dot 3rd gen.

Pros:

1) Sound quality and volume has improved a lot from previous gen.
2) Alexa and Amazon services are more integrated with Indian market which the Google lacks. For example I can book uber cab,order food in zomato,order things from Amazon without even taking out my smartphone.
3) It can used as a smart speaker,Bluetooth speaker and also it has 3.5 mm headphone jack.
4) Amazon prime membership at Rs 999 per year is the most value for money subscription. You can stream in Amazon prime video, music from prime music, become an Amazon prime member, free kindle e books and many more.Google takes monthly Rs 99 for songs only.
5) You can control smart lights and electronics from Philips, Xiaomi, Yeelight and other Alexa compatible devices.

Cons:

1) Let me be honest,Alexa can never beat Google assistant, Never(That's why I gave 4 stars)
2) It has to be kept plugged in all the time,not battery powered (same is the case with Google home)
So if you are looking for a smarter assistant to interact with, Google home is your choice. For all other uses Amazon echo speakers are better.

I got it on sale for 3k. For the price, it offers decent sound and richer bass, compared to my much cheaper, 1.5k Bluetooth speaker, the Boat Stone 260. It works seemlessly with my smart home devices, and the app is fantastic. It yet doesn't have support with fire TV stick, but Amazon assures it'll arrive by mid-november, so that's something to look out for. The app works great, and you can control your smart home or this dot from anywhere in the world, as long both of your devices have an internet connection. It's a fun little party trick, really. I couldn't be more happier with my echo dot. Also, as you can see in the picture, I got the sophisticated looking white color ;)

Edit: It has fire TV support now, it's not the best experience, but hey - it WORKS.

column4: Amazon's entry-level Echo is still one of its best üòç
column5:
Verdict
-While the previous Echo Dots were cheap ways to extend smart home control all over your home, they weren't the most attractive devices and had weedy sounds. Bought it on tha second day of Prime day in a combo
-The Amazon Echo Dot (3rd Gen) as a vast improvement on the originals, even though it costs exactly the same.
-The new finish looks fantastic and the new Echo Dot is a device that you'd happily put out on show. Audio has been dramatically improved, too, both in terms of quality and loudness, which makes Alexa easier to understand and means that the odd bit of music or radio is a possibility.
-If you're looking to put Alexa in more rooms, then this is the device to buy.

Pros
-Clear and loud audio
-3.5mm and Bluetooth audio outputs
-Same price as old model
-Improved design

Cons
-No longer USB-powered
-Not ideal for music

column4: Im satisfied and happy with my dot.
column5:
I will first give the steps to connect succesfully; for a brief general performance review, you may scroll down please.

To successfully pair your phone, wifi and echo:
1. Plug your echo on and download alexa on your phone.

2. From the alexa app, pair your phone with your echo device first to establish the first connection between your phone and your echo.

3. We need to set up wifi access on echo so that alexa on echo can be alive. To do that, after you've paired your echo with your phone, proceed to where you can search for the available wifi networks. Connect to your wifi network on alexa app by entering your wifi password. Post this, your echo should be connected to wifi and alexa on your echo should be online.

4. You can pair alexa with any bluetooth speakers if you have any. You may also pair your phone with your echo with bluetooth so that you may play your local AV via your echo. Yes you can play music from phone. To connect to bluetooth, enable pairing on your echo. To do that, command, 'Alexa pair' and you should hear alexa respond. When she does that, she is ready to pair; open your phone's bluetooth settings and connect to your echo. The connection should now be successful.

5. Develop skills for alexa and keep interracting with her so that your relationship blooms. Any relationships are funny to understand at the beggining. Believe me, there is a deep meaning and truth in my previous sentence.

As for the performance part, there's no compromise from my point of view and your echo dot can easily compete with most advanced dedicated speakers of its size.
The bass is pretty decent. The treble is at a good feel as well. At full volume, there is no screeching or dampening. The sound is premium than previous echo dot.
Echo plus will obviosuly nail it, way better than dot, so please do not compare plus with dot. Both peform exceptionally based on budget.
You cannot wire in audio to your echo dot (nevertheless, you can bluetooth in your audio), but you can wire out to external speakers. When wiring to your external speakers maintain 15cms for optimal performance.

I hope this helps. Peace'o & cheerios folks :)

column4: Good but need some AI improvements
column5:
As a speaker, it has a very good loudness and I got it for only ‚Çπ1,999 which is a very good price for this type of speaker. Sound quality is very good and crystal clear.

But as a smart speaker it need a lot of improvements. Sometimes it doesn't understand very simple questions and sentences. Sometimes it will not play the song you are telling it to play, it plays a song with similar name. Sometimes you will need to tell song's singer, and movie etc to play songs, which according to me ruins the experience.

It need a lot of AI improvements. If you are looking for a very smart speaker then go for Google Home mini or Google Home. It will not satisfy you as a AI but it has better sound quality then Google home mini and it connects with a lot of smart devices which google home mini can't. The choice is yours.

Good Speaker :- Echo Dot
Good AI :- Google Home mini

The echo dot is an incredibly awesome amazon product.
Talking about the sound quality, the sound quality is beyond expectation for me, its crystal clear and quite loud as compared to its size. Alexa integration is great, it can do things like movie tickets booking, can book a cab, it can easily be linked to apple music or other streaming services, can read news and specially it can understand hindi which is awesome. Talking about the 4 mics integrated in the device. These mics works just awesome, it does not matter how loud the music is or how far you are from alexa in a room, all you have to do is say ‚ÄúAlexa‚Äù and she activates. The best part is it does not matter how much noise in the environment, she can hear you. Echo dot can be easily linked to other devices.
It also works with almost all the smart home devices.( smart bulbs, hubs, microwave, etc)

*Note: Echo dot requires a high-speed wifi connection (more than 20Mbps) for better experience. It also requires permanent power supply. If you need a portable echo dot you can go for the portable one which was launched in December 2019.

I was in doubt while choosing between Google home mini and Echo dot but my inclination towards Amazon as a prime member and my investment into Amazon eco-system made me convinced that I should choose alexa over the other.
Packaging was very good and it contained the Echo dot and and its proprietary charger.
The Echo dot is built well with its mesh fabric design which looks good. It has volume up/down, set-up button with a nifty mute button. It has an ever convenient aux port for connecting to audio system which itself is a reason for my purchase. It can also connect with Bluetooth.
Set-up was easy with the Alexa app and there a plethora of skills to try out.
Sound was warm and the volume could be room filling. As expected there isn't enough bass but other than that the sound is good. Voice recognition is good and it may miss low voices. The Alexa voice is itself is like a person which is good and adds a personality to it. It can sometimes give very witty contextual answers. It's best used with Amazon products and generally good. Home automation is an area where it has an edge as most of the smart home products are Alexa compatible and generally speaking Alexa is best suited for Indian scene. I can stream high quality music from Amazon music being a prime member to my sound system and have added convenience of a smart speaker. You can find good deals and bundles at festivities if you are planning to purchase it.

Overall product is very good. I really loved it.
But, I returned this product because it's "Made in China".
I proud to be Indian and I respect my country and our soldiers.
If Amazon can give me choice to buy same product made in different country, then I will surely buy it again.

Review after 1 week.

It's look like very premium and stylish the sound quality also not bad...

But think twice before spending 4k because with in this price range you will get better speaker than this. As a user right now am feeling that it's is nothing more than a speaker.... Why???

1. it's very difficult to connect with your phone.

2. Need always internet.

3. It can use for setting alarms but no inbuilt battery so you always need to connect with power point.

4. Don't have usb port.

column4: Can get better in the future
column5:
So I wanted a device to control my smart home devices via my voice so I bought the echo do, I got a really good deal as I paid just 3.6k for it (The actual retail price is 4.5k).
So i v already owned an Alexa for a while .
And there are a lot of things that it can do but it also lacks in some places .

Pro's:
1. Works great with automation and wifi devices (switches , light etc).
2.pretty loud for the sound .
3.mic's are great can pic the sound really well.
4.robust design .
5.can perform tasks related to amazon and some other apps like zomato , ola , ndtv , aajtak , saavan and a few more .

Cons:
1. Cannot play music from spotify , although Spotify is now in india the echo dot doesn't support it in India it ll say that Spotify is not available in your region.
2.cannot do Google related tasks , for example if I ask it for the "price of Hayabusa" it search's for Hayabusa on amazon and tell me the price of random toys , has issue with SEARCHING for stuff.
3. Lacks a lot of voice features and has some glithes like when u tell it to start stopwatch it asks me for alarm .
4. Heats up a bit on the top .
5.wifi coverage isn't the best .
Well If you are looking for good sound and not so many voice features then echo dot is for you , but if u want to person searches and play music on Spotify then I feel google home is a better option.
Alexa can get better in the future but for now it lacks quite a lot of features

Got it for my mum who is semi paralyzed and can't move much. She now calls me by voice command and listens to her favorite music and the holy Bible.
Also have ordered for a smart bulb that she can control with her voice.
Its so simple and even a senior citizen can use it. Truly amazing.

column4: Good hardware marred by limited feature set for Indian customers
column5:
Upgraded from 2nd to 3rd Gen dot, must say the sound quality has improved phenomenally. While the previous gen dot was more of an "Echo Input" type functionality, this one can actually serve as a decent speaker. Coming to the software side:
1. Apple music not supported in India. In fact the only available services are Amazon music, Saavn and Hungama music
2. Amazon music has a very limited catalog and Indian users can't upload their songs either ( apparently US users can do this)
3. Spotify not available "yet"
4. Youtube/ Google play music not supported for obvious reasons
5. Because of the above I tried to give Saavn a shot as their catalog is surprisingly large, but then Alexa doesn't support playlists for Saavn.

Summary:
If you are planning to get an Echo for listening music - stay away from this (or any Echo device for that matter) - at least for now.

My family likes Alexa and have fallen in love with it. Alexa app is also very versatile. Go ahead. Truly amazing\n

The Alexa integration is a breeze with the new Alexa App, both of iOS and Android. Since this smart device works on cloud, it is never going to be outdated but for some delayed firmware updates.
However if you are looking at this from an audiophile perspective, try out the larger Amazon echo for its phenomenal sound prowess.
However for me the amazon echo dot 3rd generation is a perfect mix of an excellent Smart device with a reasonable good sound which lets you differentiating the low, mids and highs of your favourite songs. Welcome to the world of Alexa!

column4: I would recommend the 3gb one over the 6GB one and Indian government suxx!
column5:
Bought the 3gb one from a retail store at 18000 Indian Rupees (roughly 300 US dollars).

In India (because of a lot of tax by our corrupt government) instead of getting this card at $195 (‚Çπ13500) i got it for $300. Damn it! Indian government, stop it, get some help!

If you are an Indian, let's flood the Indian government's Twitter handle with #ReduceTaxOnGraphicsCards!

Back to the review

Works pretty much well(I guess).

Well make sure you have at least I5 6400 processor and 8gb of ram with it so it doesn't bottleneck.

Don't use the driver's which came with it (but install msi afterburner and msi kombustor from the disk) because those drivers don't work. Just Google "Nvidia Drivers" and *manually* give your GPU name and stuff , and install the drivers.

And some of you guys might be thinking to buy the 6gb version, right?
Well, I would recommend you the 3GB one only cause the difference in the performance is just 10% - 5% (6gb also has more cuda cores) and that isn't much a difference. I would not spend 6000 Indian rupees ( approx $90) for just a 10% difference. (And for non Indian guys, well... Are you ready to spend $90 just for a difference of 10 to 5 percent?).

Well if you are a performance freak, well... you can get the same performance as the big fat 6gb one just by overclocking the memory by approx 90 to 100 mhz and if that crashes your card, (and if you don't wanna increase the voltage) overclock the memory with 50mhz and the core clock with 50mhz.(it will give a slightly less performance)

Cheers!

column4: RAM stick with wrong notch placement. Doesnt fit at all in laptop
column5:
First pic : Product pic from Amazon where RAM Stick notch is in the MIDDLE
Second pic : Actual product received, has NOTCH on the far left / far right
Third pic: Laptop RAM slot which requires a RAM stick with a notch in the MIDDLE and not to far left/right.
The module thus doesnt fit.
Have ordered for replacement of the product. Hope this time they sent the correct product. I need RAM stick with NOTCH which fits in the laptop.

Edit:
Again they replaced with the same RAM module which has a notch in the far lift/far right. This does NOT fit in the laptop at all. The product pic in the description and the product sent are VERY DIFFERENT. So please be wary of buying this RAM stick. Also the model number of this and the previous stick were different than the one mentioned in the product description. Model number as per the product description is : CT8G4SFRA266, what I received was CT8G4SFS8266.C8FD1. These are very different and INCOMPATIBLE to a standard laptop RAM slot. Please BEWARE of purchasing this RAM Stick. A request to Amazon and the seller to update the product info and stop selling THIS PARTICULAR ram stick.

I have purchased many other things from this same seller and have ALWAYS been satisfied. Except this time.

Cons:
1. Product was packed in a Open Hard Plastic bag same as the size of the RAM but but without any seal. Nor any user manual or warranty details were attached. outer Packing was good.
2. Manufacturers details and serial number was really hard to verify. Although i delevered a original product but crucial must have this feature in its site to check its serial number or other details like Manufacturer details.

Great RAM sticks. Been using them with my Ryzen 5 2400g and Gigabyte B450M-DS3H motherboard with no problems at all.

The RAM sticks come with a 3000MHz XMP profile out of the box, which means that they are verified stable at that frequency from the factory. Some have also been able to achieve 3200MHz on these Teams, but I haven't tried it a yet.

These RAMs should be supported on all motherboard that use DDR4 standard and support XMP profiles. After installing them, if you do not see them running at 3000MHz, go to you motherboard's BIOS/UEFI and enable XMP(Xtreme memory profile).

One last note for those who want to use it for Ryzen, please buy 2 sticks to run in Dual Channel. I bought two 8gb sticks for a total of 16gb dual channel, and gaming performance on my Ryzen 5 is impressive.

As for the price, I bought them a month ago for Rs3100 per piece, but as of writing this review, prices are Rs4790 per piece. For me, it was a steal when I purchased them.

Overall, a great product for budget PC builds if available at a reasonable price.

column4: The original microphone has a port that looks like an LAN port
column5: \n Beware of the product if you receive one with the port that is similar to a USB type B port then you may want to return it, I bought this device back in 2018 and after replacing it for 2-3 times I always got the product with the one that has a type B kind of port or the one that is like a charging port for some cheap phones, if you look into the pictures the people have posted, the white device with the bigger port is authentic microphone, now the other one was good too, but since I never found a reference for that one anywhere on the internet so I had to return each of the replacements as I didn't receive what was advertised.\n

Thing is we get 1st copy of this product from China in the Box, I have been working with chinese products since long so i know, they make very good copy, so how i know about this product ? Serial Numbers are different on the box and on the product, and as well as we have to register the product on Original Website on Blue Microphone.

you can check how original product comes with the USB type B cable and see the backside of the mic.

So this Records our Voice fine. But this is surely not the Original Product directly made by Blue Company.

I wont suggest to order this product from This seller or in matter of fact from Amazon. better you check by yourself in shop and then only buy.

as they charge the same price and get duplicate products.

PORT IS AVAILABLE...

ND FOR VIDEO RECORDING..

USE. OPEN CAMERA.

SET AUDIO SOURCE .. external mic. If available.. u will get awsm sound quality in recording :)

Cons :

packaging is too bad. :(

Previously I have used three Microphones (Generic Dynamic, AKG, Sound KIng Beta) They were just ok type to me as I am an You Tuber "Android Mechanics". But when I got the Blue Snowball Ice, It really changed my mind. When I used for the first time, The Recorded Voice quality was so good that I myself didn't believed that it was recorded by me! It was really mind blowing for me and the best thing which I like about this is the Clarity of its recording that too without any Editing. If you are looking for a good mic for Recording Karaoke Songs or If you are an You Tuber like me then this Recorder will surely surprise you.

The Blue Snowball iCE will give the best performance If you are using the Audacity Software which is a free software for PC.
And If you want to sound more professional, you can add a Pop Filter to it, there is a gap to fit a filter to its stand.

Lets talk about its Pros and Cons:-

Pros:

-Great Build Quality
-Very easy to use (Direct USB)
-Good Design and Adjustable Head
-Very Strong Cable
-Comes with Stand

Cons:

column4: Blue Snowball ICE an excellent product - now has micro usb B port stop spreading panic
column5:

Then to verify I registered the product on Blue website, which got registered successfully with 10-12 hrs.
The Blue Sherpa app detected it automatically.
Further there is a mention in Reddit pcmasterrace ..where they ssy that blue refreshed the product with the new connector
And if you look at the latest YouTube videos in Blue channel. All the devices now have micro usb B.

The TL;DR - The connector is updated to micro usb B connectors and is not a Fake product and please stop panicking.

Coming to the product, it is amazing, noise cancellation works beautifully. Looks pretty pleasant. And Extremely easy to work with..Plug and Play. Additionally You can use the Sherpa app from Blue.

Hope this helps potential buyers... Go for it. There's no fake.

As for the mic itself, it had a few scratches on it, not a big deal. And worked just fine after plugging in. Quality is great. By far the best USB microphone at this price, no question.

column4: Easy to setup, great sound quality, best for beginners.
column5:
First of all to all those thinking that it is a counterfit or a first copy product because you got it with mini USB 5 pin port instead of a big USB type B, let me tell you it is 100% original. USB Type B is an older port and is replaced by mini usb 5 pin B which this mic would now come with. Mine was usb mini as mentioned and I was successfully able to register my product serial number with Logitech (Since Blue company is now acquired by Logitech). Even Blue Sherpa Companion app was able to find my mic with correct serial number. So relax it is original only.
Now for the review part-
1. Amazon packaging was pathetic the box was damaged, they sent me the box in a white amazon polythene instead of packing it inside a cardboard box. Not sure what happened here usually Amazon pack things nicely so I guess it was the seller (Bought it from prime seller). However luckily my mic was not damaged. (Touchwood)
2. Talking about mic itself, it is simply amazing, It captures the lows, the mids and the highs perfectly without any problems.
3. Noise cancellation is okay, not best for sure but very decent, live streaming should not be a problem at all and if you are using it for voice overs you can post process it in either audacity or premier pro to make it sound like a professional studio mic.
4. The wire sent with the mic was black for some reason even though my mic was white but it still looks absolutely stunning sitting on your desk, clubs very well with the setup, definitely an eye catcher.
5. Stand provided with it is sturdy and has nice rubber feet so it will not slip off easily and will hold it‚Äôs position.
 Overall a great mic even in 2020 for beginners and growing youtubers, definitely gives you a professional edge without putting a whole in your pocket. I bought it during covid so costed me around 5k but you should be able to find a good deal on this, though it‚Äôs still worth it at 5k considering the sound it‚Äôs amazing sound quality. Would have given 5 stars but had to cut 1 star for packaging.

If you‚Äôre looking for a condenser mic which is easy to setup and is bang for your buck, look no further and buy this. You will not regret.

Thanks for taking time out to read my review. Stay safe, be healthy and take care.

column4: Amazing Mic At Budget Review Is On Youtube Gadget Fusion
column5: \n Decent Mic For Youtube Channel Gadget Fusion\n

Ordered at night and received the item next day afternoon as part of Amazon Prime subscription. Hats off to Amazon! Packaging was great as usual from Amazon/Cloudtail.

I have posted a comprehensive unboxing/review video on my YouTube channel. Please check that out for the mic test at this link -
[...]

I wanted an entry level/budget microphone for my YouTube videos. After going through reviews of the Blue Snowball, Samson Meteorite and Blue Snowball ICE, I decided to get this one. In the package you'll get the microphone, USB cable, tripod stand and a manual. The build quality is excellent and feels very premium. The microphone itself looks very cute and stylish. It feels very solid and sturdy in the hand.

Setup is very simple. You just need to screw the tripod stand into the microphone and set it on the table. Plug the microphone into the laptop via the USB cable and the light on top of the microphone glows red. That's it! Its good to go! Its plug and play, so no drivers or software or application required. Go to Sound settings of your laptop and select the Snowball ICE as the recording device. You can then use any audio recording software (like Audacity) to record the audio. It takes power from the laptop and no separate power source required.

The Snowball ICE only has a cardioid/uni-directional mode for recording. So it'll pick up sound from any source directly in-front of it. The optimal distance between the sound source and the microphone should be around 8-12 inches. Moving farther away from the mic will reduce the intensity and up close you would hear your voice popping at the 'B's and 'P's.

If you're looking for a budget USB microphone for podcasts/YouTube videos/Skype calls, then look no further. I got it for Rs. 4399 as part of the festive season sale. Excellent microphone and I am very happy with it!

column4: Youtube Creators need this amazing product
column5: \n I really have enjoyed using my Snowball. I think the issue might be that the Snowball is the first condenser mic a lot of people have any experience with. They can put out amazing quality, but they need to be in an environment that takes into account that they pick up damn near everything. Unless you have a pop filter, a relatively quiet room, position it appropriately, run it through a mixer or make up for it by doing a good bit of processing afterwards, the quality can seem not up to par to a similarly priced dynamic. Condensers are really sensitive by nature. If you have a fan going, some crazy PC with 120MM fans blasting away, near a window where you get occassional traffic, in an open room with empty uncovered walls, then a Snowball is just going to sound like nonsense before post. If you actually have a recording area that's quiet, doesn't have a ton of wind moving through it, has some manner of sound proofing and is positioned and configured properly, then it can really shine.\n

column4: Worked well on Dell D630 Intel Centrino Duo
column5: \n BX is enough, MX not required for the old laptop I have. Detected 223.6Gb out of 240Gb as attached in the photo. Though A17 Bios is not equipped with latest firmware so it shows HDD instead of ssd, but that is fine since motherboard is way old. 10X Faster experience & better experience using ssd. A must buy suggestion for old laptops.\n

To start with crucial is a reputable ssd maker. And there after sales support, tools to migrate/clone c drive is easy to use. But it is always better to do a fresh windows install than cloning/migrating.

This is a QLC ssd, which is in theory the slowest ssd type. But what crucial has done here is added SLC caching so it behaves like SLC ssd for small files (10-20% of total capacity). If you are looking for boot drive, drive that has games installed and you generally want a storage ssd this is one to buy. If you are a photographer, video editor or a person who has to copy/paste/work with large amount of files every day then go for a SLC/MLC ssd (these are very costly). For general use you can buy a QLC or TLC SSD, they are cheap as compared to SLC/MLC ssd

column4: Got it in Rs 3969/- including 200 discount from amazon. Good choice won't regret.
column5:
I installed it on my lenovo idealpad 330E 15IKB.
Installation on lenovo laptops is a bit hectic in India. I had to extract sata adapter from caddy which i ordered from Amazon itself.
Finally after installing i cloned my os into this and setup boot preference as SSD.
I noticed a lot of difference by upgrading to ssd from hdd.
Boot time was reduced from 2min to 25sec.
Installation of GTA 5 which took 4hours on HDD only took 1:30hr. Smooth gameplay was noticible.
I also played PUBG PC LITE and opening time of it also got reduced.

We've all seen Tech videos and how upgrading from HDD to SSD feels like a night and day difference. It ACTUALLY does. Can confirm. It feels like a totally different laptop. I couldn't believe it when I first started installing windows and updates, couldn't believe the speed of just getting things done, and the responsiveness of my laptop. It's like using a 90 Hz panel for the first time.

Just installed the Crucial MX500 @ 500 gigs. Startup times and restart times are blazing fast. Takes only 30-40 seconds for a full restart. My HDD @ 5400 rpm took 5 mins and 35 seconds give or take a few.

Loading times have been reduced to a fraction of seconds. Everything seems extremely snappy. It breathed life into my HP ay516tx. Got it for 5.3k Indian rupees, and couldn't be happier.

Note: If you're installing your old HDD in an external enclosure, use a USB 3.0 one because if you use a USB 2.0 enclosure, you'll get read speeds of 60 MB/s instead of 100 MB/s which could hinder with things like games. However it will be fine for movies and photos which have no need for the full data rate.

Bought it for 2,099/- on 2nd May 2021.
Please Read full review only if you are getting black screen error after replacing HDD to caddy and SSD to laptop.

- Before SSD, Boot up time (2-3 mins till Desktop Screen), After SSD (10-16 seconds till Desktop Screen).
- Extremely light weight, even lighter than mobile chargers.
- Getting High speed. In Caddy it gives me (551 read & 549 write speed).
- Used it in original slot and placed HDD in caddy, because Windows was unable to boot it from caddy.
- Used Macrium Free Software for cloning.

In my case I was unable to boot up from SSD due to BIOS and some computer issue, after successful cloning OS to SSD, when I replaced it, windows unable to load up OS properly and shows Black Screen with White Rectangle issue. So once again I formatted my SSD (MBR partition Style) and installed new Windows Using Pen-Drive (Media Creation Tool) , and my issue got resolved, windows got installed in *New SSD within 1 hour* .
Then I deletes my OS and reserved partition from HDD and add-on that space to HDD.

column4: This thing is a beast in a small package
column5:
My first impression: superlightweight, slim, flimsy.
The installation process was a bit long-drawn because I had to clone my HDD into the SSD (and my HDD being a 500 GB one, the cloning of one partition wasn't possible, so I had to delete all my media files)
After installing, the machine changed rapidly from being a slow, OKish PC, to this ultra-fast productivity rig. I install the Crucial Storage Executive to monitor the drive as well as 1. activate momentum cache (the software it comes packaged with recommends you activate in modern PCs to avail its full power) 2. over-provision (I didn't understand this so didn't switch it ON as the laptop performed like butter as it was).
After using for over 15 days, I would say that leave at least half of the drive you've installed Windows/any OS on empty as your SSD uses that space to speed up your machine. Also, update firmware and all drivers for your system to not bottleneck.
If you're thinking about gaming, this is not the solution you want. SSDs are a storage solution, not graphics processing. Although, if you have a GPU built-in, you will see very noticeable change in games (or for that matter, any software) installation and loading.
File copying is fast enough, not even close to the advertised 500MB/sec, but it goes up to 250 MB for large files sometimes, which is sufficient because you won't even probably see the copy bar.
Booting time reasonably fast, with very little time required by background processes to start to leave my PC for me to actually start working on.

column4: Upgrade my desktop(2011) Intel I3 2 gen with SSD (284 MB/sec) from HDD(83.68MB/sec)
column5:
SSD works at high speed , most people buy CPU when desktop get slow.

I purchased SSD 2 days back and using in old desktops bought in 2011. New CPU is required if CPU utilization is reaching more than 70% otherwise CPU do not need any upgrade. Intel is only able to add Bus speed from 1333Mhz to 3000Mhz which will only reduce few 1 nano sec.

HDD used to work at 83MB/sec sequential reads where as SSD working at 284MB/sec with SATA 2 cable.
After connecting to SATA 2 and Power, I boot the computer and cloned the HDD to SDD using free software Macrium Reflect. Videos available on YouTube
After clone SSD, switched the boot sequence in Bios (F10) from hard disk to SSD.
Thats it. Do it yourself. Its easy SSD is must for any old desktop.

Format the HDD after 2 or 3 days , once you are comfortable with SSD clone and all your software working fine. Keep HDD for storing big files for later use.

The Crucial MX500 1TB SATA 2.5-inch 7mm Internal SSD is an excellent value for money product, I got read/write speeds up to 500Mbps. I brought it for my HP Notebook - 15-ay011tx laptop which had a Toshiba HDD. Hastel free installation and replacement for my old laptop.
Value for money.
Easy to install.

I earlier used to think that those who say that SSDs speed up your computer by 10 times are just exaggerating- well, they are not.
The speeds are FASTER than advertised(not significantly though).

As for the price, it is fairly affordable at Rs.1790.
Booting is ten times faster, opening chrome takes zero time. I haven't tried any game though.
For an average user, it is undoubtedly the best choice.

I got it delivered within 3 days in perfect condition, so thanks Amazon for that.

Overall, satisfied with the purchase.
Nothing to complain.

I am writing this review after using this SSD for about 2 months.
So far it is working really good without any BSOD(Blue Screen Of Death) or any other issues.
I am mentioning some points which will remove your doubt regarding the upgrade to SSD.

1. Is it compatible with old system like decade old or having SATA 2.0 or SATA 1.0 ?
Ans. Yes it's compatible but speed will be reduced to SATA 2.0 or SATA 1.0.

Some old system requires BIOS update to fully recognised the SSD , so keep your BIOS up to date(If BIOS update is available).

2. Which attributes in SMART(Self monitoring , analysis reporting technology ) to be checked for SSD health?
Ans. Download Crystal disk info to check smart attributes.
In smart attribute, check for wear leveling count it is directly related to the health of the SSD, as you write on SSD ,wear leveling count decreases.
Some may notice that just after some 200 GB write wear leveling decreases to 99 from 100 but in reality it only decrease by 0.1 ,that is from 100 to 99.9.

3. Impact on SSD on sudden shut down i.e., power cutoff ?
Ans. Now a days SSD can resist power cutoff but its highly recommended to not do sudden shut down as repeatedly doing may cause SSD to fail.
In SMART attribute check for POR(Power On Recovery) count ,it will tell how many times SSD goes shutdown unexpectedly. For every one sudden power off POR count increases by 1.

4. What to check just after upgrading to SSD ?
Ans. Check Power on count , power on hours, both must be at zero initially.
All the attributes should be at 100 in crystal disk info. If not then it is used one and should be replaced.

5. Warranty issue on Samsung ?
Ans. Upon registration on Samsung website it is showing out of warranty , don't worry it will honor the warranty according to the invoice provided.

6. Warning : Never defrag the SSD as it will rewrite the same data on the same section of the SSD which can cause poor wear leveling and repeatedly defragmentation may cause SSD to fail.
OS like Windows 7 or XP do defrag the SSD so keep them disabled permanently.

7. For Mac users whose SSD becomes very slow or gets failed after 1 or 1.5 years it is because in mac the trim function is disabled by default for non OEM SSD (SSD not pre-installed by Apple) so just after installing the OS in mac do enable the trim function.

8. It is recommended to fresh install the OS in SSD instead of migrating OS from HDD to SSD as some settings is optimised for HDD which may cause trouble from SSD or SSD may not work to its maximum potential.

9. Before installing the OS in SSD do change the SATA protocol from ATA or IDE to AHCI in BIOS as AHCI is optimised for SSD.

10. Do know about DRAM and DRAMLESS SSD and choose the SSD wisely , DRAM SSD is costly but having much faster RANDOM read and write than Dramless SSD.

11. Don't tweak the OS default settings just for sake of SSD health like virtual memory or fast startup as it may cause your system unstable, don't worry about TBW value as it requires many years even to reach 50 percent of total TBW.

column4: SSD, a must for any computer | Install & witness huge performance boost | Review| Guide | Comparison
column5:
So here am i with the new Samsung EVO 250GB M2 SSD ready to be deployed in all new Dell Inspiron 5580 to unleash the beast mode. Even top-class hardware will crawl if any of component is low grade which in my case its 5400rpm HDD. So i ordered SSD in the first place.

Since, I earlier had 2.5" SATA SSD in my XPS laptop, which was an upgrade to 7200 RPM SATA HDD, it was impossible for me to continue with HDD only config in this new Inspiron as it was laggy everywhere with huge boot time, app open time, slow interface, etc. It's like, once you get used to SSD, you just can't accept HDD in any case. :D

Got it from Amazon @3599 during prime days. Normally it's available for 5k approx with MRP of 7999. A few years ago got the same SSD (EVO 850) in 2.5" form factor for double the price ~8.5k. Technology & price have interesting relationships. :D

‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢
INBOX
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

1. Solid State Drive
2. Warranty & Installation Guide
3. Samsung Magician Software Leaflet

‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢
PROS
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

1. Highly reliable SSD by Samsung.
2. As expected, the performance boost is great.
3. Drive has great read/write speeds as per industrial standards.
3. 512MB DRAM cache for performance improvement. Many SSD manufacturers skip this cache.
4. It comes with 5 years warranty or 150 TBW.

‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢
CONS
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

1. Doesn't come with mounting screw. But that's the case with all. Many laptops will already have it in place.
2. No heatsink provided. But again, the same is the case with all.

‚ñ∂ Samsung is a pioneer in this department of SSD and its EVO series is distinguishable by its name only, but still, they can provide certain addon things mentioned above to further kill the competition.

‚ñ∂ These cons affect initial setup and long term performance. 1 star deducted for that. So a ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ star device.

‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢
INSTALLATION
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

‚Üí I went on opening up all-new Inspiron 5580 to reveal the internals (following official guide by Dell available at support page) & install Samsung 860 EVO M2 SSD. But a surprise was waiting inside to spoil my plans.

‚Üí There was no SSD screw mount & screw inside. I contacted Dell customer care, hardware support, authorized seller/service center, local hardware shops, etc & spent hours over the phone but without any luck. So had to settle with the double-sided tape, which in fact is quite risky. But so far its working good. I'll have some better custom screw mount arrangement in near future to secure SSD.

‚Üí In general, most of the laptops won't require any mount for SSD. Only a screw will suffice to secure it in place.

‚Üí As expected, there's huge performance improvement everywhere, super-fast boot time, snappy interface, faster apps, games, etc. In short beast mode is now active.

NOTE

‚ñ∂ Installation instructions vary from model to model & manufacturer to manufacturer. So, it can't be detailed here. To know about that, just head to the support page of your laptop manufacturer to find an official guide or perform a general search for disassembly instructions of your model. You will definitely find some text or video guide to do it.

‚ñ∂ Remember to use SSD as a primary OS drive, else your investment will be useless if you boot using HDD only and use it as a parallel storage drive only.

‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢
OS & SOFTWARE SETUP
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

Once you install SSD you have two options to either clone HDD to SSD or to fresh install OS. I personally prefer a fresh install as it refreshes everything.

As a general practice, you should format & reinstall OS once every year to refresh it & to remove junk built up over time. You can always feel the difference after a fresh install. Also if you have recently upgraded your OS, a format or reset is recommended to avoid a variety of incompatibility issues that may arise.

1. Cloning can be done using any related software like Minitool Partition Wizard, EaseUS, Samsung Data Migration, etc. For this, you need to install SSD first and then clone the existing OS into SSD using the tool. After that, you need to make it the first boot device using Bios. You can easily find detailed guides for this task.

2. Fresh install is very simple. Just install the drive in the slot, use USB drive or DVD to install OS into the SSD and change boot options to make SSD as a first boot device. Before fresh install, you have the option to change the mode to AHCI or RAID via BIOS. Choose as per your needs. Changing it later on breaks the already installed OS and you won't be able to boot into it.

‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢
SCORES: HDD vs SSD
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

‚Üí 3D Mark 11: 3487 vs 3668
‚Üí PCMark 10: 2638 vs 3197
‚Üí PCMark 8: 3507 vs 3635
‚Üí Cinebench R20: 1151 vs 1175
‚Üí Read Speed: 134 MB/s vs 552 MB/s
‚Üí Write Speed: 123 MB/s vs 530 MB/s
‚Üí Boot Time (post-OS selection screen to windows desktop): 40 s vs 4 s
‚Üí Shutdown Time: 45 s vs 10 s

‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢
SAMSUNG EVO 860 SATA vs WD GREEN SATA vs NVMe SSD
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

There is this WD green available for half the price of Samsung SSD, but if it's cheaper, there's a reason for that. Remember a thumb rule, "you get what you pay for".

Samsung SSD comes with 5 yrs warranty while WD comes with 3 years warranty. These drives have limited life span wrt terabytes written, but Samsung is confident enough wrt their quality to provide you a 5 yrs warranty. There're other hardware differences b/w both wrt built-in DRAM cache 512MB vs none, power consumption (2.2 W vs 2.8 W), controller, latency, technology, etc.

In all there's WD Green (SATA) for budget-oriented people, then Samsung EVO 860 (SATA) in medium-range to balance price-performance ratio, & for extreme performance seekers there's Samsung EVO Series (NVMe). HDD to SSD (SATA) & then to SSD (NVMe), performance & price both increase.

Read speed ratio is like- HDD : SSD (SATA) : SSD (NVMe) - 100:500:2000 MB/s.
So an obvious performance difference.

‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢
SAMSUNG MAGICIAN
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

Samsung Magician is an interesting software that you can get officially. If performs a variety of tasks like auto firmware update, run performance benchmarks, run performance optimization, securely erase the disk, manage overprovisioning, manage rapid mode, etc.

You can always install it to avail above features and check the status of SSD in terms of condition, bytes written, etc.

‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢
WARRANTY & TBW THING
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

TBW or Terra Bytes Written is a term used by SSD manufacturers to assess how much data can be written to the SSD before it is likely to fail.

EVO 860 comes with 150 TBW or 5 years warranty, whichever occurs earlier. You can monitor TBW in Magician software. Don't worry, 150 Terra Bytes is too much to be written to a hard disk and an average user is unlikely to shoot up this limit in 5 years or even 10 years.

So far, mine has 1.5 TBW in a matter of a month with medium usage (daily run time of 12-15 hours with browsing, blogging, video editing, gaming, etc). So it will have only 90 TBW by the end of 5 years at the current usage rate.

You can reduce TBW with few tweaks and restricting SSD to only critical things eg installing non-critical software to HDD, moving hibernation file to HDD in case if you use hibernation a lot, etc. Paging file also contributes a lot to TBW but it's not recommended to move it to HDD as it will hamper performance a lot.

‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢
VERDICT
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

‚ñ∂ Samsung EVO ss a nice buy in this price range, balancing price to quality & performance ratio. If you want the best of both worlds, then this is the thing you should get. (Read/Write speeds approx 550/530 MB/s)

‚ñ∂ If on a tight budget, but want to have SSD goodness, go get WD Green for half the price of Samsung EVO 860 SATA SSD. You will still have huge performance differences visible across the OS if coming from regular HDD. (Read/Write speeds approx 100/80 MB/s to 500/450 MB/s)

‚ñ∂ If you can extend your budget further & your laptop supports NVMe standard on M2 slot, get NVMe SSD instead of SATA, say Samsung 960 EVO. (Read/Write speeds approx 3200/1900 MB/s)

‚ñ∂ If budget is not a concern to you and you just want the best of it, without any doubt get Samsung 960 Pro. (Read/Write speeds approx 3500/2100 MB/s)

Overall, getting SSD is recommended for obvious reasons. If not NVMe SSD, at least get a SATA SSD (be it WD Green or Samsung EVO, as per your budget) and unleash the hidden beast inside your rig.

It's a 2.5inch sata 250gig ssd, i installed by replacing my cd drive in my lenovo IdeaPad 320e 15.6" laptop, i bought a caddy for 500rs. and it fits perfectly,
Performance was very much noticable compared with hdd, had to do some research to migrate win10 from 400gb partition in a 1tb hdd to this 250gb ssd, i used a tool named, 'EaseUS Todo Backup Free' to migrate windows 10,
Boot speed on hdd was about 50-60seconds, now on ssd , boots within 16 seconds, android studio, Photoshop, Dreamweaver everything starts auickly and are snappier, feels good, go for it.

Samsung has been leading the SSD race since a long time and its 850 EVO series was a charm. I decided to go for this newer and better 860 EVO 500 GB SSD and I have only one word for the performance...Premium.
The SSD is as fast as it can be on the SATA interface and the performance boost from a conventional HDD is noticeable.
The only complaint that I have is that they market it as a 500 GB drive while when you install it you get 465.75 GB.
I bought this because of the NAND chip that this drive uses, compared to non-NAND based cheaper SSD's this is more reliable to store data and promises longer lifetime.
So far I will definitely recommend this model to anyone who is looking for an SSD with 500 GB capacity.

column4: One of the top SSD in consumer class
column5:
I have Samsung SSD working in my 7 year old laptop (Dell 7720 SE), I had paid 13k for 250GB variant at that time. Currently I am using Kingston and Samsung SSDs in my other laptops and desktops.
I can recommend this Samsung SSD based on my experience for sure, regarding warranty Samsung has said that there is some issue at the website, because as soon as you register your SSD on their website it show 'out of warranty'. So as per Samsung warranty can be availed using the invoice, your SSD is covered with warranty as mentioned on Samsung website against the SSD model. If you don't have invoice then warranty will be given from the date of manufacturing.
If don't have high budget then you can go with affordable option like Kingston, as I am using them as well from long time. You won't feel any difference in day to day use, only difference you can see between high capacity SSDs (like 1TB or 2TB) and smaller size SSDs (like 120GB or 240GB), when you will be copying large files (i.e.,100GB). Higher capacity SSDs tend to have larger RAM (chache), due to which they can hold high speed copying (500MB/Sec or higher) for longer than smaller SSDs, because smaller SSD will have small amount of RAM (chache). With Samsung you can expect longer SSD life than other brand. Hope this would help someone to decide his/her SSD purchase decision.

column4: A perfect upgrade for my 1 year old OMEN..
column5:
The best in class SSD.

Please note: This model doesn't come with the MSata to USB adapter neither does it have the screws for fitting. For the ones with the adapter buy a product of which the model number ends with RW.

Works like a charm, read and write speeds are consistently around the 450-500 Mbps bracket.

I cloned my existing OS to this one and it works like a charm.

Now let's talk about performance, I used this to upgrade my Hp OMEN which has a i5 on board and since the upgrade the good old machine is giving a run for their money. And builds a strong case for people with an existing i5 machine to upgrade to an SSD. Now I haven't thrown away the old HDD, I just bought an enclosure to convert it to an external backup HDD which ensures the previous hardware doesn't become redundant.

Now being a casual developer I have the complete Netbeans IDE, WAMp and Xampp servers installed along with Photoshop and Corel, add to that I keep on using Dockers, Containers and Kubernetesa few games like Sniper, NFS payback, the combination of the above are going to even kill the latest of the machines with an i7 under it's hood if you don't have an SSD. Now with the SSD on board this machine handles the stuff almost as good as a i7 laptop that I use for similar purposes. However gaming would still be a huge challenge as it depends primarily on the graphics card which renders great performance.

This investment has to be one of the best I haveade ever and people who still aren't willing to give up on their old buddy (machine's) with an investment as little as 10k you can significantly upgrade the specs and the performance.

column4: It's like getting a new computer!
column5:
Changing your computer‚Äôs internal spinning hard disk to a solid-state drive (SSD) is like getting a turbocharged upgrade; add some RAM, and you‚Äôve got yourself a new computer in performance terms.

My setup: iMac 27‚Äù [late 2013], 1TB, 8GB RAM
Problem: Inexplicable beachballs, auto restarts, hangs, slow boots, very slow app launches‚Ä¶
 ‚Ä¢ Apple Hardware Test: all ok
 ‚Ä¢ Apple Disk First Aid: all ok/repeated corruption of Snapshots
 - Approach: Clean installed OS, data restored from iCloud and Time Machine. Problems recurred after a week.

My diagnosis: Ageing disk, probably with few bad sectors that Apple formatting APFS was tripping over. Decided to change internal HDD to SSD, and add more RAM.

Samsung 860EVO 500GB seemed the best, affordable choice. Would have preferred the ‚Äòblade‚Äô NVMe 970 Pro, but it is more than double the price; more importantly, it‚Äôs incompatible with the iMac‚Äôs pin and channel configuration.

So, I picked the Samsung 860 EVO and 
; 
  for my upgrade.

Upgrading the internal drive of a slim-profile (5mm) iMac is not easy. Even in experienced hands, there is a very high risk of damaging the LED display panel, which has to be sliced off the aluminium chassis (see iFixit‚Äôs tutorial). Even more dangerous is remounting the display panel, as the quality and strength of the tapes sold online are highly suspect, with many users reporting that their displays fell off and smashed after remounting with such tapes.

The OEM adhesive strip used by Apple is a custom 3M VHB tape (5mm wide, 1 mm thick). So I spoke with 3M India, and after keeping me dangling in hope for 3 weeks, they stopped taking my calls. Thanks 3M. :(

The workaround was to shop around with Apple Authorised Resellers / Service. None of them would sell me the mounting tape separately, but they would do my disk upgrade for a price ranging from ‚Çπ4800 to ‚Çπ2500 (tape + service). Seemed the better option, as it mitigated the risk of damaging the display panel and ruining my Mac.

Preparation:
‚Ä¢ Installed the Crucial RAM myself (8GB x 2 slots).
‚Ä¢ Cloned my existing hard drive to the Samsung SSD 860 EVO, and ran it externally as the boot drive to check things out, for about a week.
‚Ä¢ Took my Mac and new, data-loaded and bootable SSD to an Apple Authorised Service Center, on the appointed date.

2 hours later, my upgrade was done.

I did not buy or use a 3.5 to 2.5‚Äù drive adapter; double-sided tape is sufficient to mount the SSD inside the iMac‚Äôs chassis (technicians concurred). Neither does the SSD require an external ‚Äòthermal sensor‚Äô; it runs cool.

Post upgrade:
1. The first thing to do after the SSD is the internal boot drive is to startup normally, and do a full Time Machine backup.
2. Once done, ENABLE TRIM (by default, Apple disables TRIM on 3rd party SSDs).
3. Open Terminal, and type in (exactly, without the quote marks): ‚Äúsudo trimforce enable‚Äù, then Y when asked ‚ÄòDo you want to proceed?‚Äô
4. Reboot and press SHIFT (for SAFE BOOT)
5. After boot, go to Ô£ø > About this Mac > System Report > SATA / SATA Express and see that TRIM is enabled
6. Reboot normally, and you‚Äôre done!

* Note 1: It is ALWAYS a good idea to keep at least 25% of your drive free for better system performance, so move those large files to an always-connected external device.
* Note 2: Samsung Magician does not have a Mac version

Post the upgrade from OEM Seagate 7200 rpm 1TB to Samsung 860 EVO SSD 500GB, drive speed is up almost 300%. All the spinning beachballs, unexpected shutdowns, and interminable startup times are gone. Things work at a snap (almost zero latency).

So far, I‚Äôm delighted!

column4: HP Pavilion 15-ab035ax HDD - SSD Migration ( Genuine Windows 10 )
column5:
Wanted to replace the ailing HDD with SSD and lease a new life to my HP Pavilion 15-ab035ax
Ordered on 8 June 2020 and received on 12 June 2020. The seller is Appario Retail Private Ltd. Thank you guys! The price paid for 500 GB Samsung EVO SSD is Rs. 6999.

Oh!, and for the records this SSD s MADE IN CHINA.

Preparations.
***********
Took stock of my current OS was genuine Windows 10 running that was upgraded from OEM installed Windows 8.1. Data was already backed up in an external HDD. My Microsoft account was already linked to Windows 10 product key.
My first attempt to Migrate Windows 10 to SSD alone using USB recovery disk failed. Though the BIOS recognized the SSD, somehow the OS recovery using USB recovery disk was never completed at the end. Tried almost all configurations I just did not wanted wait to buy a caddy tray and experiment for lack of time. So, the second method of fresh OS install seemed to be the workable option.
(Later on, I found out by web searches why the recovery process did not work. The EVO SSD was already partitioned! That means the existing partitions should be removed to install Windows 10 properly).

Method that worked.
***********************
1. Removed the HDD and installed SSD in that place.
2. Changed BIOS setting to boot from USB. SSD was already detected and shown in BIOS.
3. Downloaded Media creation tool from Microsoft and created USB bootable disk (Need 16 GB minimum. I used a 32 GB Sandisk USB drive for safety)
4. Boot from the newly created bootable Windows 10 - version 2020. remove all exiting partitions and used complete disk for OS. No manual partitioning.
5. After various reboots competed, connected to internet. Let the OS installation complete.
6. Log on to the freshly installed Windows 10 using my Microsoft account (To which the Windows 10 CD Key is linked)

Voila! My revitalized, super-fast 'fresh' Laptop is ready with all the required bells and whistles!

Notes.
*******
1. Samsung recommends 10% of your disk space should be allocated to overprovisioning.
2. If you have enable RAPID mode ( Kind of using RAM for disk write operations , in order to speed up things, you will have to allocate around 1.5 GB of memory to this operations. Go for this only if you are a minimum of 8 GB memory. I have not used RAPID mode because I don't need to write anything huge to the disks.

Verdict.
********
Considering all other alternatives, I found it is better to upgrade the HDD to SSD and add more RAM to my 5 years old laptop is the best way of utilizing resources during this Covid 19 time. Upgrading to Samsung EVO SATA SSD perfectly helped me to achieve that goal. My laptop is pretty fast to boot and does not heats up like before. That, by itself a great improvement.

column4: Good SSD But with Warranty Issues
column5:
The SSD is good & Fast. But has Warranty Issues. I have bought the SSD on 17/09/2018, But then it's showing as Out of Warranty since 31/08/2018 which is 17 days prior to the billed date (refer Pic). They show it as 5-year limited warranty on Amazon too. I have not bothered much because the SSD was working fine.

Pros:
1) Awesome Performance
2) Booting is very Fast (My Laptop Config is i7, 16GB)
3) Read & Write Speeds are Great (See Pic)
4) Apps open very fast
5) Samsung Magician Software is very much useful for tuning the Drivers.
6) Samsung Data Migration Software / Tool is very fast to take backup/cloning of Complete OS & also the Installed Apps. So, after swapping the SSD your PC / Laptop all your apps & OS will be in the same state but they run much faster.

Cons:
1) First and ForeMost once you receive the SSD check the warranty status with the Serial Number (Samsung Site or Samsung Magician Software) & then only proceed to install OS or other apps.
2) I have not used the SSD for a year then I had some issues with SSD detection after some time after some hard work it worked. I was worried that it's gone.
3) After the above Con's I would suggest going with a WD or Kingston SSD's which are much more reliable & reasonably priced ( I don't see a reason why Samsung has charged a premium for this product except for Brand Image).

Hope, my experience and suggestions would Help someone.

Hello Amazonians,

My existing setup is as follows:
Laptop: Legion y740 15inch with RTX2070 MaxQ
HDD: 1TB 2.5 inch (7mm) 7200rpm (stock)
SSD: 128GB m.2 NVMe Pcie 2242 m+b key (stock) with Win10Home

Wanted to upgrade both the:
A.) existing 1TB 7200 rpm HDD as well as the
B.) 128GB m.2 NVMe pcie SSD

With:

A.) 2TB Samsung 870 EVO 2.5inch SATA SSD
B.) 1TB Samsung 980 m.2 (2280) NVMe pcie SSD m key (for Win10 OS).

As i only use the Lenovo Legion y740 15" for gaming purpose so with games having humongous download sizes, 1TB HDD was filling up faster (was left with only 250GB of 1TB space) and also the 7200rpm drive was real slow for game load times (waiting of 3-5 mins) for a game load.

As of the current Gen, a NVMe pcie based m.2 SSD is the fastest drive in the market and Samsung 980 is the latest iteration from its new lineup of m.2.

Ofcourse there are the PRO version m.2's as well but those are just out of budget and out of scope from a gaming/home use kind of scenarios unless one is into heavy video editing, designing and vfx purposes.

Installing both the SSDs is fairly simple as just the screws are to be removed (follow your laptop manual for the same) and pop in these in their respective slots and secure them with screws.

A word of caution though: m.2 slot on the laptop/desktop motherboard are mostly "M Key" based (female notch placed at the right side of a m.2 SSD that goes into the male notch on the motherboard). Also, most laptop/desktop motherboards easily support varying lengths of m.2 SSDs like 2242 2260 and the longest 2280 (22 is the width in mm where as the last 2 numbers i.e. 42, 60 and 80 are the lengths in mm).

Also, a 2.5 inch (7 mm or 9 mm) HDD/SSD enclosure can also be bought so that you can keep your old HDD/SSD as a portable HDD/SSD within the enclosure. I bought the transparent ORICO 2.5 mm model 2193U3 HDD/SSD enclosure (have reviewed that as well) and i keep my 7200 rpm 1TB HDD inside this enclosure after having it replaced with the 2TB Samsung 870 EVO.

Likewise, there is also an enclosure for the m.2 NVME PCIE SSD available from the same brand, ORICO. Check it out at amazon.in as well.

So, I made a BOOTABLE win10 usb (using the Windows Medial tool online) so that I can install the OS on the newly installed m.2 2280 ssd and the entire process took less than 30 mins from hardware installation to OS inatallation from USB to the new m.2 ssd.

There is Less to No Comparison of Quality and Price of Samsung SSDs with other brands like Sabrent, Crucial, WD etc.

Kindly like the review if it helped to make your buying decision that much easier.

Cheers and e-peace...

column4: A must have for all laptops with HDD
column5:
My laptop is now 6 years old and running Windows 10. Over a period of time, I had found it to become slower.
Even formatting and reloading doesn't help for too long. A friend of my suggested to replace the HDD with SDD and I'm glad I did. My previous HDD was 1TB however, windows itself doesn't take much size, so I decided to go for a 500GB instead. I gave this product 5/5 because of the below reasons:

1. Cost - I paid Rs. 5200 & got a cashback of Rs. 530, which effectively brought down the cost to Rs. 4670
 This was cheaper than the other brand, so I decided to go for it. For me, its worth it.
2. Light weight - compared to the older HDD
3. Easy to fix after searching for videos online.
4. Amazing speed - The boot time is greatly reduced, programs load much faster.

Do download Samsung Magician software provided by the maker and use it.
Videos explaining features are also available online.
I've enabled RAPID mode as well as Over Provisioning of 10% and enabled Trim.

Whether you want to make your old laptop faster or simply make the new one even more faster, go for it.
It also reduces the risk of hard disk failure as no moving parts, data transfer is really fast between USB drives and it comes with a 5 year limited warranty.

Cloning was a bit cumbersome since Samsung Data Migration did not go well even after i executed it twice. Perhaps my old HDD has some bad sectors and the app couldn't get through. However with AOMEI Backupper, cloning went smooth and I could clone all the partitions smoothly.
Once the HDD was replaced with this SSD, wow! the machine became superfast; booting in 2 seconds. Samsung magician software detected the HDD and performance benchmarks says 559 Read / 529 write speeds.
The only issue I faced was with the Warranty. After registering the product, the site mentioned that the SSD was out of warranty. But after contacting Samsung support, they said that the site was under maintenance and the warranty would be based on Invoice date. Settled with that as of now.
Overall a perfect buy though the price is a bit on the higher side,
